alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clinton; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 12:40PM EDT until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan, south central Michigan and southwest Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Gratiot and Montcalm. In south central Michigan, Calhoun, Clinton, Eaton, Ingham and Ionia. In southwest Michigan, Allegan, Barry, Kalamazoo, Kent, Ottawa and Van Buren. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 PM EDT, Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain has fallen in the last few hours across the area. While the heavy rain has now tapered off, minor flooding can be expected for another few hours as water finds its way to the rivers and creeks in the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
